title: Peppermint OpenFace
content:
A fun typeface for light-hearted projects. I've used it primarily for t-shirt designs and posters for children's activities. I know it isn't the usual fare for folks around here. Available at Myfonts.com for $10 - includes the solid and the openface forms.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry-west/wild2-peppermint/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry-west/wild2-peppermint/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024950im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PM_SnowAd500_6365.jpg)

Thank You for not brandishing pitchforks and lighted torches....
author: phrostbyte64

comments.content:
Not something you'd use everyday, but I think it looks really cool :D  
The odd angles really make each character stand out, so that the whole word seems to be alive. I can see it being used for a coffee shop advertising a peppermint latte or something.

Peace,  
JT
For some reason this brings "The Nightmare before Christmas" to my mind, in a good way.
Very nice. Chromatic type is always fun!

I like it. I don’t associate this with holidays tho.

Feels like it go with words like:

burrito  
picanté  
salsa

:-)

nice! i think it goes with both holidays and taco's!
